articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Gabon
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Gabon
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Ali Bongo Ondimba on his re-election as president of the Republic of Gabon.
					 The message wished the Gabonese president good health and happiness and success in his work, expressing expectation that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would develop onto a higher stage.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Meets New Egyptian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Meets New Egyptian Ambassador to DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, had a talk with Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady, new Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK who paid a courtesy call on him, on Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho returned home Thursday after taking part in the 71st UN General Assembly.

articles.title: Chinese Government to Provide Free Relief Goods to Afflicted Northern Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Government to Provide Free Relief Goods to Afflicted Northern Areas of DPRK 
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The government of the People's Republic of China decided to provide free relief goods to flood-hit northern areas of North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 Earlier, the Red Cross Society of China and the Chinese Embassy here sent aid materials there.

articles.title: CPRC Spokesman Condemns S. Korean Authorities for Slandering DPRK in UN Arena
articles.content:
CPRC Spokesman Condemns S. Korean Authorities for Slandering DPRK in UN Arena
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Country (CPRC) of the DPRK gave an answer to a question put by KCNA Thursday as regards the fact that the south Korean puppet group of traitors impudently took issue with the DPRK's international position in the UN arena.
					 South Korean puppet Minister of Foreign Affairs Yun Pyong Se said at the UN General Assembly on September 22 that the "north has customarily  violated the UN resolution," adding that it should be called into question whether it is qualified for being a member of the UN.
					
					 The spokesman said: 
					
					 Yun made such reckless remarks out of despair and consciousness of setback that neither sanctions nor pressure can deter the DPRK from bolstering up its nuclear force. They amount to acknowledging themselves before the world that the sanctions against the DPRK and moves to stifle it pursued by the Park regime together with their U.S. master so far have totally gone bust. They, at the same time, clearly revealed that they are driven into a tight corner.
					
					 The puppet group accused the DPRK of "violating the UN resolution" and "mocking at the UN" and the like but, in actuality, it is none other than the U.S., the Park Geun Hye group of traitors and other vassal forces that wantonly violated and mocked at the UN Charter.
					
					 It is preposterous and shameful for the Park regime to dare find fault with the international position of the dignified DPRK as it is no more than the U.S. colonial puppets without any political independence and military sovereignty.
					
					 The desperate efforts made by the Park Geun Hye regime to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, failing to face up to the trend of the times, would only prompt the latter to take  a series of measures to bolster up its nuclear force and precipitate the former's final doom.

articles.title: UAWK Spokesman Denounces Park Geun Hye Group for Killing Peasant
articles.content:
UAWK Spokesman Denounces Park Geun Hye Group for Killing Peasant
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) on Thursday made public a statement denouncing the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for killing innocent peasant Paek Nam Gi who wanted elementary right to existence.
					 The statement branded the hideous unethical act as a crime indelible down through generations to come and bitterly condemned it in the name of all the agricultural workers in the DPRK.
					
					 Terming Park Geun Hye kingpin of murder who had been sentenced to death by the people long ago for her crime of turning south Korea into the worst tundra of human rights and hell in the world, the statement went on:
					
					 It is too natural that south Korean people from all walks of life call Park Geun Hye a murderer, while deeply lamenting Paek Nam Gi's death.
					
					 All Koreans keenly feel that second and third deaths like Paek's will occur in south Korea as long as Park Geun Hye is allowed to go scot-free.
					
					 The peasants and other people of south Korea should bring Park to the tribunal of people to settle accounts with her for her hideous crimes.
					
					 All the agricultural workers in the DPRK will always fully support the righteous struggle of the south Korean peasants for justice, democracy and the right to existence.

articles.title: Medical Oxygen Factory Goes Operational
articles.content:
Medical Oxygen Factory Goes Operational
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Medical Oxygen Factory was newly built at the suburbs of Pyongyang and went operational with due ceremony on Thursday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Su Gil and officials concerned, those in the fields of public health, employees of the factory and builders.
					
					 Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk said that the factory was built as a monumental edifice embodying the loving care for the people thanks to the personal initiative and energetic leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He underscored the need to scrupulously manage equipment and improve technical control in order to keep the equipment in full-capacity operation, keep the production going at a high rate, supply quality oxygen to preventive and curative medical institutions to make sure that the party's love reach the people.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentation and Exhibition in Field of Furniture Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentation and Exhibition in Field of Furniture Held
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation and exhibition in the field of furniture were held at the Pyongyang University of Architecture on Thursday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were officials, teachers, researchers and technicians in the fields of science, education and furniture production including the Architectural Engineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences, Pyongyang University of Architecture and the Taedonggang Furniture Factory.
					
					 It heard tens of papers made in the researches to introduce the latest science and technology in the fields of furniture design, production and materials and improve the quality of goods.
					
					 More than 80 designs of over 20 kinds including designs of furniture types and fixtures were presented at the exhibition, drawing attention of the participants.

articles.title: Int'l Day of Older Persons Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
Int'l Day of Older Persons Observed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Workshop on International Day of Older Persons 2016 was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Thursday.
					 It was attended by officials of the Central Committee of the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea and relevant units, meritorious persons in Pyongyang and members of foreign embassies, the United Nations Population Fund, WHO and the European Union Programme Support here.
					
					 Speeches were made under the titles of "On immortal feats performed by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu in the history for the care of the elderly in our country", "World population aging situation and vista" and "It is noble sense of obligation of the generations to come to put forward and respect the elderly".
					
					 The seminar informed the participants of the life of the elderly of the DPRK and the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for the care of the elderly and successes and experience achieved in the work to carry out the policy and the future activities.
					
					 The participants watched an art performance given by members of the Culture and Art Association for the Elderly of Korea and watched elderly persons drawing.

articles.title: Wangjaesan Art Troupe Gives Performance at Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Wangjaesan Art Troupe Gives Performance at Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex
 Chongjin, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Wangjaesan Art Troupe started its performance tour of provinces at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex from September 29.
					 Among the audience were workers and officials of the complex.
					
					 The performance began with music "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu". Put on the stage were songs, dances, instrumental music and other colorful numbers.
					
					 In female chorus "Our Comrade Kim Jong Un" and female duet "His Humanity", the artistes impressively depicted the boundless pride and self-esteem of the army and people of the DPRK under the care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Female solo and pangchang "It Is Offensive" and light music "Higher and Faster" inspired the workers and officials of the complex who turned out in the drive to increase iron and steel production necessary to recover from the flood damage in the northern areas of the DPRK.
					
					 Tap dance "Cheerful Cook" and other numbers revved up the atmosphere of the performance. 
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Russian VIPs Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian VIPs Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Sergey Nekhaev, vice-governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and patriotic lives of his family members at his old home in Mangyongdae, the guests went round historical relics preserved with much care.
					
					 They toured the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, Taedonggang Pig Farm, the Nature Museum, the Central Zoo, etc. and laid a bouquet before the Liberation Tower.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests including a vice-governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia and his party visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday.
					 The guests paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues in the palace.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Personage
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Russian Personage
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Vladimir Miklushevski, Governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned on Wednesday by Sergey Nekhaev, vice-governor of the Maritime Territory Administration of Russia, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful at Int'l Synchronized Swimming Tournament
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful at Int'l Synchronized Swimming Tournament
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK players bagged four gold medals at the 2016 "Suv-Parisi" International Synchronized Swimming Tournament held in Uzbekistan from September 21 to 24.
					 The tournament brought together 110 players of nine countries including Russia and Belarus. 
					
					 Han Kyong Ryong and Min Hae Yon took first place in solo events of juvenile and youth categories respectively.
					
					 In duet events Han Kyong Ryong and Kim Jin Ju bagged gold medals in juvenile category while Min Hae Yon and Jang Hyon Ok in youth category.
					
					 DPRK players returned home on Wednesday.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Participants in the international scientific symposium for marking the 70th anniversary of Kim Il Sung University visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the university Thursday.
					 They laid floral baskets and bunches of flowers before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a reply message from Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic (LPDR), on Aug. 22.
					 The president in his reply message sincerely thanked Kim Jong Un for sending warm congratulations and best wishes to him on his 79th birthday.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the traditional friendly relations between the two parties, states and peoples of the LPDR and the DPRK would steadily grow strong.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and success in his noble work.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdul Hamid, president of the People's Republic of Bangladesh, on Sept. 16.
					 The president in the message extended warm congratulations and greeting to Kim Jong Un on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed belief that the genuine relations between the two friendly countries will grow stronger in various fields.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK durable peace, progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation Departs
articles.content:
Lao High-Ranking Youth Delegation Departs
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking youth delegation of Laos headed by Sonethanou Thammavong, secretary of the C.C., the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union, left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches Leave
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the World Communion of Reformed Churches led by President Jerry Pillay left here on Thursday.

articles.title: Chongam-Haksong Railway Section Restored in DPRK
articles.content:
Chongam-Haksong Railway Section Restored in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Chongam-Haksong railway section was reopened in the flood-stricken North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK on Sept. 27.
					 The railway service was interrupted by the stormy wind and heavy rain which swept the northern part of the country's North Hamgyong Province. 
					
					 A campaign has been conducted by members of the shock brigade in charge of the Hyesan-Samjiyon railway construction and workers of the Chongjin Railway Bureau, Hoeryong and Kilju railway branch bureaus, the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, Wonsan Rolling-Stock Complex and other affiliated units under the Ministry of Railways to rebuild the railway.
					
					 The reopening of Chongam-Haksong railway section, the longest section in the restoration project, makes it possible to rapidly increase the freight traffic for the recovery efforts.

articles.title: Road Restoration Progresses apace
articles.content:
Road Restoration Progresses apace 
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The temporary restoration of roads was finished in the flood-hit areas of North Hamgyong Province, the DPRK.
					 The province reopened the road between Musan Pass and Hoeryong only in 24 hours on September 4 and reconstructed the road between Chayu Pass and Yonsa for 10-odd days.
					
					 Yonsa, Musan, Onsong and other counties in disaster area have also restored roads by themselves.

articles.title: KCNA on Park Geun Hye's Attempt at Stay in Power
articles.content:
KCNA on Park Geun Hye's Attempt at Stay in Power  
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Traitor Park Geun Hye obsessed with ambition to stay in power is making last-ditch efforts.
					 She convened various kinds of confabs almost every day where she spouted invectives that "a war may break out on the Korean peninsula" to deliberately create the feelings of crisis in the whole society, while rallying conservative forces.
					
					 Timed to coincide with it, pro-Park Geun Hye group within the "Saenuri Party" was already closeted over the issue to put forward her as next-term "prime minister" or representative of the party.
					
					 She is rallying conservative forces while talking about the "situation of state emergency". Lurking behind this is the despicable intention to evade the political crisis and pave a way for stay in power.
					
					 Her madcap stick to the power is the deep-seated disposition of the "yusin" dictator.
					
					 Whenever she finds herself in a tight corner, she cried out for the "establishment of security posture" just like her father applied ruling method, and revived the heinous one-man fascist dictatorship. 
					
					 During her stay in the power, she claimed the "spirit of Jindo dog" and posted confrontational maniacs with strong attachment for "yusin" and murderous spirit to Chongwadae and fascist power organs and, made it a "national policy" to escalate the confrontation with compatriots in the north.
					
					 She kicked off the campaign of "eliminating the forces following the north" and mercilessly cracked down on political dissidents and progressives including the Unified Progressive Party, the Teachers Union and Jaju Minbo, thereby laying a foundation for stay in power.
					
					 She also sold off the nation's dignity, interests and right to existence to outside forces without hesitation through the decision to deploy THAAD and the humiliating "agreement" on the sexual slavery issue for the Imperial Japanese Army in a bid to maintain her office.
					
					 As long as viper-like Park Geun Hye holds power, south Korea can not but turn into the horrible fascist dark society where people may face a nuclear war, to say nothing of reaching the worst phase in their living.
					
					 Park Geun Hye's stay in power will lead to the worst nightmare and unprecedented disaster in the nation's history.
					
					 She was already sentenced to death for all kinds of crimes she committed.
					
					 She is aware that a noose will be put around her neck the moment she leaves office. Therefore, she is getting frantic staking her fate on stay in power.
					
					 She is well advised to clearly understand that her dream to stay in power will only bring the same tragic end as met by her father.
					
					 The south Korean people should heighten vigilance against the ambitious stay in power sought by Park, the worst dictator in the world and number one trouble maker of the nation, and sternly punish her and her group in order to remove the root cause of trouble.

articles.title: No Force on Earth Can Block Victorious Advance of Independent Nuclear Power: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No Force on Earth Can Block Victorious Advance of Independent Nuclear Power: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- No force on earth can block the victorious advance of the DPRK, an independent nuclear power, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Fear-stricken by the measures taken by the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrence, the U.S. and its vassal forces are driving the situation on the Korean peninsula to an extreme phase.
					
					 However, the DPRK views the reckless acts of the hostile forces as no more than stupid behaviors.
					
					 Such tragedies as wanton violation of dignity and sovereignty of nations took place in not a few countries in the world due to the U.S. strong-arm actions and aggression in the new century. But thanks to the Songun politics the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a nuclear power which even the U.S., styling itself "the only superpower" in the world, dares not invade.
					
					 This stirring reality is entirely thanks to the Songun politics of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The validity and might of the politics is now being fully displayed under the present complicated international situation.
					
					 The DPRK clearly showed the world its declaration that it is capable of reducing the U.S. to debris with nukes is not hot air.
					
					 The U.S., obsessed with the "weapon almighty doctrine", is trying to browbeat the DPRK by ceaselessly introducing its strategic assets into south Korea, but the people of the DPRK remain unfazed by their muscle-flexing.
					
					 The U.S. had better properly know that the DPRK is not such a weak country which can become a target of its muscle-flexing but a nuclear power possessed of even H-bombs.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can apply the logic of strength to the DPRK as it is doing to some countries.
					
					 The service personnel and civilians of the present generation will certainly inflict upon the U.S. its final doom in its history of wars.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japan's Extreme Repressive Racket against Chongryon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japan's Extreme Repressive Racket against Chongryon
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have gone extreme in their repressive racket against the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). They are running wild like hungry wolves. 
					 Days ago right-wing gangsters brought dozens of loudspeaker vans to blare "Expel Chongryon from Japan." The ruling Liberal Democratic Party is trumpeting about an action to put on the list of prohibiting the reentry into Japan more Chongryon officials returning after visiting the DPRK and tighten the measure to limit remittance of money.
					
					 Commenting on the above-said ruckus, Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes:
					
					 These are nothing but the reckless moves of those scared by the inexhaustible might of Juche Korea making a long drive under the banner of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 Looking back on history, the Japanese reactionaries have been apt to groundlessly pull up the DPRK and direct the spearhead of their anti-DPRK campaign to Chongryon whenever there took place events in the DPRK to demonstrate its national power.
					
					 As lots of scenarios worked out by the Japanese authorities to isolate and stifle the DPRK proved to be unworkable, they have gone so wicked and desperate as to crack down on Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese authorities have legal and humanitarian obligations to guarantee the rights of the Koreans in Japan and properly treat them in the light of the historical background against which they were forced to settle in Japan and the legitimate status of Chongryon.
					
					 However, Japan has persecuted and suppressed Koreans in Japan under absurd pretexts, refusing to make apology and reparation for its past crimes for the last more than seven decades. This is adding to its thrice-cursed crimes committed against the Korean nation.
					
					 The DPRK can no longer remain a passive onlooker to the compatriots suffering pain in Japan.
					
					 The army of Songun Korea has built its military muscle to have the nation's pent-up grudge settled. It will never pardon those who hurt the destiny and vital rights of the Koreans but mercilessly punish them.

articles.title: Minju Joson Lambastes S. Korean Military Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Hysteria
articles.content:
Minju Joson Lambastes S. Korean Military Warmongers' Anti-DPRK Confrontation Hysteria
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet military warmongers are going reckless in their moves for escalating confrontation with the DPRK, taken aback by its nuclear thunder of justice.
					 Minju Joson Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet military warmongers are making a hysteric bluff to provoke the DPRK though they are no more than cannon fodder of the U.S. imperialists and a medley of soldiers without any power. This only brings to light once again the treacherous anti-reunification nature of the Park Geun Hye group of traitors steeped in the confrontation with the compatriots in the north to the marrow of their bones.
					
					 Their confrontation hysteria is a revelation of their cynical ploy to tide over their ruling crisis by fostering serious "security unrest" in south Korea under the pretext of the "nuclear threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 They are working hard to seek the way of tiding over their ruling crisis in escalating the above-said confrontation and intensifying the maneuvers for a war against the north. That is why they are making such fuss over "security unrest" under the pretext of "nuclear threat from the north".
					
					 The group of traitors is staging north-targeted saber-rattling in collusion with the U.S. while talking about "strong retaliation" against "threat."  This is like a puppy knowing no fear of a tiger as they are working hard to overcome their strategic inferiority caused by the DPRK's emergence as a nuclear power.
					
					 It is pitiful for the group to go busy escalating the confrontation with the compatriots in the north, kowtowing to the U.S. on the decline.
					
					 Only a miserable ruin awaits the Park group going reckless in the confrontation racket, still unaware they are at death's door.

articles.title: S. Korean Opposition Parties Blast Impudent Arbitrary Practices of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
S. Korean Opposition Parties Blast Impudent Arbitrary Practices of Park Geun Hye
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean opposition parties are strongly reacting to the puppet chief executive's arbitrary act of turning down the demand of the "National Assembly" for dismissing Kim Jae Su, Minister of Agro-Forestry, Livestock and Foodstuff, for his scandals.
					 The floor spokesman for the Minju Party of south Korea in a press interview on Sept. 24 said that the motion calling for dismissing the minister passed through the "National Assembly" thanks to solidarity among the opposition parties despite the obstructions of the ruling party.
					
					 The floor spokesman for the same party in a commentary on Sept. 25 noted that Park Geun Hye turned down the above-mentioned motion, adding that her attitude was an intolerable behavior ignoring the NA and the people as she was more arrogant and obstinate than Park Chung-Hee.

articles.title: Struggle Is Only Way to Right to Existence
articles.content:
Struggle Is Only Way to Right to Existence
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Association of Rice Producers and the Federation of Peasants Associations in south Korea held a rally in Seoul on Sept. 22 with over 5 000 peasants from 80 regions involved, demanding the guarantee for peasants' right to existence and resignation of the Park Geun Hye regime, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 It is an eruption of the pent-up resentment and grievance against the outside forces' colonial enslavement policy devastating agriculture and the south Korean authorities' policy ruining agriculture, Ri Hye Suk, chairwoman of the management board of the Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County, South Hwanghae Province, the DPRK said in an interview with KCNA.
					
					 She went on:
					
					 During the presidential election, Park Geun Hye made such commitments as the "era of people's happiness", but after her assumption of "presidency", she opened the rice market to others.
					
					 It is needless to say that the opening of rice market only adds misery to the poor livelihood of peasants at a time when grain markets in south Korea are flooded with American surplus agricultural products.
					
					 This clearly proves the true color of Park Geun Hye group of traitors who have committed without hesitation such brutal acts as impoverishing the people's livelihood for the sake of the outsiders.
					
					 The reality shows that the south Korean peasants can never escape from such miserable situation, as long as the U.S. colonial enslavement policy and Park Geun Hye puppet group's policy are allowed in south Korea.
					
					 The right to existence can be achieved only through the struggle.

articles.title: S. Korean People Demand Punishment of Arch Criminal Who Caused Paek Nam Gi's Death
articles.content:
S. Korean People Demand Punishment of Arch Criminal Who Caused Paek Nam Gi's Death
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The bereaved family of peasant Paek Nam Gi and the measure committee, religionists and bereaved families of victims of the ferry Sewol disaster held a press conference in front of the hospital of Seoul National University where Paek Nam Gi's body is placed on September 26 at which they declared an action for punishing the arch criminal who caused his death, according to the south Korean newspaper Korea Economic Daily.
					 Speakers said the "government" did not make any apology for the death of Paek Nam Gi though he died due to police violence. They declared an action for probing truth behind the case and punishing the arch criminal.
					
					 They called upon south Koreans from all walks of life to set up incense-burning altars in all parts of south Korea and launch memorial candlelight rally, probe the truth behind the case, punish the arch criminal and take measures to prevent the recurrence of similar murder.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Term Present Regime Cruel One
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Term Present Regime Cruel One
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People Wednesday in an editorial denounced the puppet regime for its cruel acts of killing peasant Paek Nam Gi and attempting to desecrating his body.
					 It accused the police of making quarrel with the court over the issue of conducting autopsy of his body.
					
					 The prosecution took the same attitude, the editorial said, adding that the peasant's family filed complaint with the chiefs of the Police Agency and the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency and others responsible for it in November last year, but the prosecution failed to announce any investigation results.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Denounces Authorities for Evading Responsibility for Pushing Paek Nam Gi to Death
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Denounces Authorities for Evading Responsibility for Pushing Paek Nam Gi to Death
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The Bar Association for Democratic Society of south Korea in a commentary on Sept. 26 accused the puppet prosecution and the police authorities of trying to make an autopsy of the body of Paek Nam Gi so as to evade the responsibility for pushing him to death.
					 The commentary said that their action is bereft of any medical and legal ground.
					
					 It demanded they stop their actions aimed to inflict untold suffering on the deceased and his family.

articles.title: Art Works Depicting Kim Jong Suk Posted on Russian Websites
articles.content:
Art Works Depicting Kim Jong Suk Posted on Russian Websites
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- 20 odd art works dealing with exploits of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk were posted by the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK on its website on September 23.
					 The Russian Institute of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia posted similar art works on their websites.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of DPRK Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of DPRK Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups to observe the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Guinean newspaper Horoya dedicated a full page to an article illustrated with a photo of the Mirae Scientists Street, which said the DPRK is a country for the people just like its nomenclature, giving a detailed account of the popular policies being enforced in the DPRK.
					
					 News agency, State TV Broadcasting Service and National Radio of Angola aired programs about the exploits President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the founding and development of the DPRK and about the miracles and innovations being performed by the Korean people in the building of an economic giant under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Peruvian newspaper Callao Daily dedicated three full pages to an article.
					
					 It said the DPRK has covered the road of proud victory and glory with the Juche idea as its firm guidelines under the guidance of the great leaders.
					
					 It introduced the proposal for reunifying Korea by federal formula, recalling the Korean people have suffered untold misfortune and pain due to national division caused by outsiders.
					
					 It also said the DPRK has bolstered its capability for national defence in every way to cope with the hideous moves of the U.S. and its followers to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The Venezuelan newspaper Tribuna Popular carried an article praising Kim Il Sung for liberating the country, leading the Fatherland Liberation War to a victory and founding the party, state and army.

articles.title: KPA's Stand Supported by Russian Bodies
articles.content:
KPA's Stand Supported by Russian Bodies
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Russian bodies posted articles on websites on September 23 and 24 supporting the statement made by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army (KPA) which declared that it would mercilessly smash the reckless provocative moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces through a military retaliatory strike of justice.
					 The Young Red Vanguard under the Party of Working Russia in an article noted:
					
					 Recently the U.S. and the south Korean military warmongers are getting desperate in their reckless military provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 Their ultimate goal is the "regime change in the north" through "elimination" of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 As clarified by the spokesman for the General Staff of the KPA, the U.S. will see the DPRK's real power.
					
					 The only way for the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces is to behave prudently, not infringing upon the dignity and security of the DPRK.
					
					 The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK in an article said the situation on the Korean peninsula is inching close to the brink of a nuclear war due to the military provocation of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 Noting the KPA General Staff spokesman clarified the principled stand of the revolutionary armed forces to take military counteractions under the prevailing situation, it said the U.S. should know that the warning of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK is not hot air.

articles.title: UK Bodies Urge U.S. and S. Korea to Stop War Drills
articles.content:
UK Bodies Urge U.S. and S. Korea to Stop War Drills
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet authorities should stop anti-DPRK war moves if they truly want peace.
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Korean Friendship Association UK and the British Preparatory Committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu said this in a joint statement on September 23.
					
					 The statement said the situation on the Korean Peninsula is getting ever more serious as the days go by owing to the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Recently the U.S. imperialists let two B-1B strategic nuclear bombers make shuttle flights in the air over the area of south Korea along the Military Demarcation Line to threaten people's Korea.
					
					 Furthermore, the south Korean puppet authorities vociferate about "direct attack" on the supreme leadership of the DPRK and "regime change of the north" through "elimination of the supreme leadership."
					
					 A spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army stated that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers' anti-DPRK military provocations have pushed the situation on the Korean peninsula to the uncontrollable and irreversible phase of the outbreak of a nuclear war.
					
					 We fully support the stand of the Korean people and the Korean People's Army to wipe out the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet warmongers.
					
					 It is the brave and steadfast anti-imperialist revolutionary stand to destroy the citadel of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet reactionaries.

articles.title: DPRK Praised as Country of Genuine Human Rights
articles.content:
DPRK Praised as Country of Genuine Human Rights
 Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Press media and public figures of different countries are unanimous in praising the DPRK in which all the people are leading an independent and creative life as the masters of the state and society.
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer said in an article that the DPRK guided by the Juche idea is, indeed, the country which fully guarantees the genuine rights and dignity of its people.
					
					 A member of the national secretariat of the Youth Organization of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola said that the DPRK is the country for people as its name says and the DPRK people are leading a happy life thanks to the popular policies pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea and the government, noting it is wonderful there is no one jobless in the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK said that there exist exploitation of man by man and no genuine rights of human being in the U.S., but in the DPRK man is regarded as the most precious being and the traits of helping and leading each other forward prevails the country thanks to the people-oriented policies.
					
					 The Syrian paper Al Baath said that the U.S. and its followers are pulling up the DPRK over its "human rights" situation, adding:
					
					 But the universal 12-year compulsory education system is now enforced throughout the DPRK and modern houses for the people are built at state expense and offered to them gratis. There are no tax and no one jobless and everyone is provided by the state with a stable job in the DPRK.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con nuevo embajador de Egipto
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con nuevo embajador de Egipto
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Su Yong, departio el dia 29 con el nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de Egipto en Corea, Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Gobierno chino decide donar materiales de socorro a zonas damnificadas coreanas
articles.content:
Gobierno chino decide donar materiales de socorro a zonas damnificadas coreanas
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El gobierno de la Republica Popular China decidio donar los materiales de socorro a las zonas septentrionales de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que sufrieron danos por las inundaciones. 
					Con anterioridad, brindaron la asistencia tambien la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de China y la embajada china en Corea.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia calumnia anti-RPDC de camarilla traidora surcoreana
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia calumnia anti-RPDC de camarilla traidora surcoreana 
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que la camarilla traidora surcoreana censuro en la escena de la ONU la posicion internacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria dio el dia 29 a la ACNC la siguiente respuesta:
					El dia 22, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores del Sur de Corea, Yun Pyong Se, disparateo en la Asamblea General de la ONU que "el Norte de Corea (RPDC) viola como de costumbre la resolucion de la ONU" y que "hay que tomar en consideracion si este tiene la calificacion de ser miembro de la ONU". 
					
					Este disparate parte de la desesperacion y del sentimiento de derrota por no poder impedir con ninguna sancion o presion el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC.
					
					De esta manera, Yun reconocio a la faz del mundo el fracaso de la campana de sancion y aplastamiento anti-RPDC que persigue el Sur de Corea junto con su amo norteamericano. Al mismo tiempo, demostro que los titeres surcoreanos se encuentran en el abismo sin salida. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos calumnian tanto a la RPDC con las sofisterias como "violacion de la resolucion de la ONU" y "burla a la ONU", pero de hecho, los que infringe brutalmente la Carta de la ONU son precisamente EE.UU. y sus seguidores incluso la banda traidora de Park Geun-hye.
					
					Es muy ridiculo e ilogico que la banda de Park Geun-hye, que no pasa de ser una marioneta colonial de EE.UU. sin tener la independencia politica ni el poder militar, se atreve a hablar de la posicion internacional de la prestigiosa RPDC. 
					
					Mientras la banda de Park intensifique la campana de enfrentamiento anti-RPDC sin darse clara cuenta de la tendencia de la epoca, se ampliaran mas multiplemente las medidas de fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC y se adelantara el arruinamiento total de los traidores surcoreanos.

articles.title: UTAC denuncia asesinato de campesino surcoreano
articles.content:
UTAC denuncia asesinato de campesino surcoreano
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En su declaracion fechada 29, el portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea condeno categoricamente, en nombre de todos los trabajadores agricolas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, a la camarilla traidora de Park Geun-hye que impuso la muerte al Paek Nam Gi, campesino inocente que deseaba el elemental derecho a la supervivencia.
					Este acto antietico es imperdonable asesinato de mayor gravedad, critica el documento y prosigue:
					
					Park Geun-hye es la caudilla de matones condenada ya a la muerte por la poblacion surcoreana por haber convertido el suelo surcoreano en el peor infierno donde no hay derechos humanos.
					
					Es natural que los habitantes de distintos estratos del Sur de Corea lamenten mucho la muerte de Paek Nam Gi y denuncien categoricamente a Park como asesina diabolica. 
					
					Ahora, toda la nacion vuelve a constatar que si perdona a Park, se repetira el incidente de Paek Nam Gi. 
					
					Los campesinos y otros habitantes del Sur de Corea deben ajustar cuentas de todos los crimenes cometidos por la traidora. 
					
					Todos los trabajadores agricolas de la RPDC apoyaran y se solidarizaran siempre con la justa lucha de los campesinos surcoreanos levantados en la lucha por recuperar la justicia y la democracia y defender el derecho a la subsistencia.

articles.title: Inaugurada Fabrica de Oxigeno Medicinal
articles.content:
Inaugurada Fabrica de Oxigeno Medicinal
Pyongyang, 29 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la Fabrica de Oxigeno Medicinal recien construida en las afueras de esta capital.
					  En la ceremonia inaugural, que tuvo lugar el dia 29, estuvieron presentes Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Su Gil y los funcionarios de sectores vinculados y de salud publica, los empleados de la fabrica y los constructores.
					
					  El ministro de Salud Publica, Kang Ha Guk, en su discurso inaugural, dijo que la fabrica es la creacion monumental signada del amor al pueblo, construida gracias a la iniciativa personal y la direccion energica del Presidente Kim Jong Un.
					
					  Destaco la necesidad de poner en pleno funcionamiento los equipos cuidandolos bien segun la norma tecnica y normalizar en alto nivel la produccion.
					
					Al suministrar a los organos de tratamiento y prevencion el oxigeno medicinal de buena calidad, hay que hacer al pueblo beneficiarse realmente de las politicas populares del partido, concluyo.
